lead_paragraph: Matt Halischuk gave Canada its fourth consecutive world junior title Saturday night, scoring 3 minutes 36 seconds into overtime for a 3-2 victory over Sweden in Pardubice, Czech Republic. In the third-place game, Russia beat the United States, 4-2.
snippet: Matt Halischuk gave Canada its fourth consecutive world junior title Saturday night, scoring 3 minutes 36 seconds into overtime for a 3-2 victory over Sweden in Pardubice, Czech Republic. In the third-place game, Russia beat the United States, 4-2.
